title: Update LIVE badge text and lobby padding

requirements.summary: Lobby cards: remove numeric count from the LIVE badge text while keeping the pulsing dot.
acceptanceCriteria: In the lobby (chatroom cards), when a room is live, the LIVE badge text renders as "LIVE" with no preceding number.
The pulsing dot indicator remains visible on the LIVE badge.
No other lobby card counts/metadata (e.g., the connected/users row) are removed or altered.

file_operations.description: Update the lobby card LIVE badge to render text as only "LIVE" (remove formatted activeUserCount from the badge text) while keeping the pulsing dot indicator; keep the separate Users/displayCount row unchanged. Remove any now-unused imports (e.g., formatCompactNumber) caused by this change.

requirements.summary: Lobby only: set LIVE badge vertical padding to py-0.5 without changing horizontal padding.
acceptanceCriteria: Lobby LIVE badge uses top/bottom padding equivalent to 0.125rem (e.g., Tailwind class py-0.5).
Left/right padding stays the same as before (e.g., px-2 remains unchanged).
Visual change applies only to the lobby LIVE badge, not the chatroom page LIVE badge.

file_operations.description: Adjust the lobby LIVE badge container Tailwind classes to use py-0.5 for top/bottom padding, keeping existing left/right padding (px-2) unchanged; ensure this change is limited to the lobby card badge styling.

requirements.summary: Chatroom header: remove numeric count from the LIVE badge text while keeping the pulsing dot and leaving the connected count unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: In the chatroom page header, when a room is live, the LIVE badge text renders as "LIVE" with no preceding number.
The pulsing dot indicator remains visible on the LIVE badge.
The separate "connected" indicator and its numeric count remain unchanged.

file_operations.description: Update the chatroom header LIVE badge to render text as only "LIVE" (remove formatted activeUserCount from the badge text) while keeping the pulsing dot indicator; ensure the separate "connected" count line remains unchanged. Remove any now-unused imports (e.g., formatCompactNumber) caused by this change.
